availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: W. W. White (Armorer and storekeeper for quartermaster's department (U.S.A.))

body.p: Armorer in for Kentucky Volunteers (U.S.A.) in 1861. Storekeeper for the U.S. Army War Department in 1861. Captain and Provost Marshall of the 18th Congressional District of Pennsylvania. Tried for malfeasance in Washington, D.C. in 1864.

ab.bibl:
KYR-0001-019-0117
Register of Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of the United States on the Thirtieth September 1861 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1862), 107.
Case Files of Investigations by Levi C. Turner and Lafayette C Baker, 1861-1866, (Civil War Subversion Investigations) NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M797, Roll 0085.
